name: tapu
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
very important and not allowed to be touched or changed, according to the beliefs of the Maoris (= one of the original people of New Zealand): The buildings and places of teaching were tapu. A tree such as this was highly tapu. Compare
taboo
More examplesFewer examplesThese places are regarded as burial sites and are tapu.The Europeans were free to go anywhere, except places which were tapu.The dead were tapu and anyone who touched a dead body became shunned by all.
